name: Architects Building
architect: Richard H. Marr, Marcus R. Burrowes, Lancelot Sukert
description: The Architects Building is a seven-story commercial building with a reinforced concrete frame faced with buff brick and trimmed in stone, resulting in a Neo-Classical Revival composition. Located in Detroit's Cass Corridor, it is oriented towards Brainard, and it is the tallest building in the immediate vicinity. Its exterior is in good condition, although alterations to the storefronts have occurred.
statement_of_significance: The Architects Building was erected in 1924 and is significant for its original purpose of bringing architectural professionals and trades under one roof. It was occupied by several notable architects like Richard H. Marr and Marcus R. Burrowes and is a reflection of Detroit's rapid growth and building boom in the early 20th century.
